assessment.title: Nools Basics - Create a Nools rule - 2b

body.p: In the Nools rule below, which constraint aligns with the following English constraint (click on the correct section of the code)?
IF there is a Fraction fact (call it f1) such that its name is the first element in givens (call its denominator f1Denom and call its convertedForm "f1Convert")

feedback.p: Incorrect. This constraint specifies that there should be a Problem fact, not a Fraction fact.

Incorrect. This constraint specifies that we should have a Fraction fact whose name is the 2nd element in givens (in javascript, arrays are indexed at 0). This constraint also says we should call the Fraction f2 instead of f1.
Incorrect. This constraint specifies that we should have a Fraction fact whose name is equal to f1Convert (the convertedForm part of f1)
Incorrect. This constraint specifies that we should have a Fraction fact whose name is equal to f2Convert (the convertedForm part of f2)
Incorrect. This constraint specifies that there should be an InteraceElement fact, not a Fraction fact.
